abstract.text: A base class for sound event nodes that connect to form a node hierarchy.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: This class defines the base functionality for an object that, depending on the derived class’s type, either plays audio or hands off the invocation to one or more other nodes.

content.text: Configure a Sound Event Node to Play Audio

inlineContent.text: To play audio with this class, retrieve a sound-event node asset (
) that generates sound events by creating and registering one of the audio-providing node definitions in
and pass the node definition in the
argument with a unique name that your app refers to later when generating a playable

content.text: Configure a Node Hiearchy that Reacts to Your App’s State

inlineContent.text: You can create a hierarchy of nodes that blends audio based on your app’s parameters, or plays the right audio based on your app’s state. To create the hierarchy, register one of the control nodes in
The particular configuration you choose for a node hierarchy instructs PHASE on which audio to play, when to play it, or whether to hand off an invocation to one or more child nodes (
For example, if you register and invoke a
objects, PHASE plays the audio of one of the child sampler nodes based on the current value of the switch node’s metaparameter. For more information, see

abstract.text: Create dynamic audio experiences in your game or app that react to events and cues in the environment.
A base class that adds a name to framework assets.
Registers the root node of the sound event asset.
A node that smoothly fades between the audio of its child nodes.
A node that plays all its children at the same time.
A base class that adds a name to framework definitions.
A unique name for the definition.
A base class for nodes that provide audio data to generate sound.
A sound event node that invokes one of its child nodes at random.
A node that plays complete audio data.
A sound resource stored in the asset registry.
An object that determines which audio to play.
The playback status of audio.
The object’s meta parameters.
A template object for sounds that can play in reaction to environmental state.
A base class for sound event nodes that connect to form a node hierarchy.
An array of child sound event nodes.
A node that passes invocation to only one of its child nodes.
Objects that connect to form a hierarchical tree of audio actions.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
